intro: Pariana imberbis, commonly known as the hairless pariana, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
